intro: Gochnatia velutina, commonly known as the velvet gochnatia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Gochnatia velutina is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions.
